TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IDataSourceFieldSchema

Docs.summary: Provides basic functionality for describing the structure of a data field at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The IDataSourceFieldSchema interface allows a class to implement a set of properties that describe a field in a data source. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class implements the IDataSourceFieldSchema interface.
Classes that implement the IDataSourceFieldSchema are used by custom control designer components to provide lists of data source fields and properties for data-bound controls at design time.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of data stored in the field.
Gets a value indicating whether the value of the field automatically increments for each new row.
Docs.value: if the field's <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType%2A> is numeric and the underlying field increments automatically as new rows are added; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the Identity property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AutoIncrement%2A> property. In SQL Server, an Identity column is a numerical column that automatically increments with each added record, thereby ensuring that the value uniquely identifies that record.

Docs.returns: if the field's <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType%2A> is numeric and the underlying field increments automatically as new rows are added; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the field is editable.
Docs.value: if the field is read-only; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>, the IsReadOnly property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ReadOnly%2A> property.

Docs.returns: if the field is read-only; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether values in the field are required to be unique.
Docs.value: if data in the field must be unique; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the IsUnique property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.Unique%2A> property.

Docs.returns: if data in the field must be unique; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicting the size of data that can be stored in the field.
Docs.value: The number of bytes the field can store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the Length property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.MaxLength%2A> property.

Docs.returns: The number of bytes the field can store.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>object, the Name property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the field can accept values.
Docs.value: if the field can accept values; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object, the Nullable property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AllowDBNull%2A> property.

Docs.returns: if the field can accept values; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum number of digits used to represent a numerical value in the field.
Docs.value: The maximum number of digits used to represent the values of the field if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType%2A> property of the field represents a numeric type. If this property is not implemented, it should return -1.
Docs.returns: The maximum number of digits used to represent the values of the field if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType%2A> property of the field represents a numeric type. If this property is not implemented, it should return -1.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the field is in the primary key.
Docs.value: if the field is in the primary key; otherwise, .
Docs.returns: if the field is in the primary key; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the number of decimal places to which numerical values in the field are resolved.
Docs.value: If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType%2A> property of the field represents a numeric type, returns the number of decimal places to which values are resolved, otherwise .
Docs.returns: If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema.DataType%2A> property of the field represents a numeric type, returns the number of decimal places to which values are resolved, otherwise .
